argument.description: The substring to search for in string.

description: The PostgreSQL strpos function returns the location of a substring in a string.
sample:
postgres=# SELECT strpos('Tech on the net', 'T');
 strpos
--------
      1
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT strpos('Tech on the net', 't');
 strpos
--------
      9
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT strpos('techonthenet.com', 'h');
 strpos
--------
      4
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT strpos('techonthenet.com', 'Z');
 strpos
--------
      0
(1 row)
